2019-08-04.Desc: Join Cultivate for their Sundays in the Garden with live music in their beer garden! 12 weeks of bands, breweries, and non-profits. This week features Transient Artisan Ales & Arclight Brewing Company, and this event will help raise money for the Youth Arts Alliance.

2019-08-06.Title: National Night Out
2019-08-06.Desc: Join Public Safety along with local non-profits at Lillie Park South for the annual National Night Out event, with the goal to join together to increase participation in crime prevention efforts by individuals, neighborhoods, and businesses. There will be emergency vehicle displays, resource materials, children's safety tips, giveaways, and more.

2019-08-06.Title: A Cappella Around Main
2019-08-06.Desc: 'A Cappella' Around Main is an 'a cappella' celebration every first Tuesday of the summer in downtown Ann Arbor! Enjoy shopping, eating, and being serenaded all at the same time! Singing groups will be strolling the sidewalks and businesses with song.  This month features the Huron Valley Harmonizers, Voices in Harmony, and the Arbor Consort.

2019-08-07.Title: Gratzi's Farm to Table Free Cooking Demo
2019-08-07.Desc: Gratzi's seasonal Farm to Table series is back! Meet Chef John Somerville at 11:00 a.m. at the Kerrytown Farmer's Market as he procures locally sourced ingredients. Then join him that night at Gratzi Ann Arbor for a free cooking demo with a complimentary micro-antipasti.

2019-08-08.Title: “Welcome to Paradise,” World Premiere by Julie Marino
2019-08-08.Desc: At one age can one find a soulmate? Are there boundaries to true friendship and affection? Two people find each other in the Caribbean and find love and acceptance with each other, despite their differences in age.

2019-08-08.Title: Crazy for You
2019-08-08.Desc: A zany rich-boy-meets-hometown-girl romantic comedy.  Crazy for You tells the story of young New York banker Bobby, who is sent to Nevada, to foreclose on a theatre.  In Deadrock, Bobby falls for spunky Polly, the theatre owner’s daughter.  But Polly takes an instant dislike to the city slicker, so Bobby vows—through razzmatazz, and a hilarious case of mistaken identity—to win Polly’s heart and save the theatre.  Songs include “I Got Rhythm,” “Embraceable You,” “But Not for Me,” “Nice Work if You Can Get It,” and “Someone to Watch Over Me.”

2019-08-09.Title: Saline Summerfest 2019
2019-08-09.Desc: On one fine summer weekend, on the streets of Downtown Saline, a wonderful assortment of activities, attractions, and amusements will bring together people of all ages and interests. It’s a super hometown celebration – Saline’s Summerfest 2019!

2019-08-09.Title: Dexter Daze Festival 2019
2019-08-09.Desc: Dexter Daze is getting ready for it’s 48th year! This annual event is a community celebration and festival that takes place on the second weekend of August. There will be music, artisans, crafters, businesses, and free entertainment for all ages! There will also be children-focused entertainment and performers.

2019-08-10.Title: Movies in the Park
2019-08-10.Desc: Join in on this family event with playground games beginning at 8:00 p.m. followed by a current family-friendly movie shown on a 20' screen. Bring your picnic blankets, snacks, and coolers (no alcohol)! This is a free event.

2019-08-11.Title: Ton-Up Ypsilanti Motorcycle & Music Festival
2019-08-11.Desc: This is a free festival: just show up, bring the family! You don't need to have a motorcycle to enjoy this festival, just show up and join in the fun and enjoy the great live music, vendors, food, and beverage while looking at the coolest bikes in all the land.

2019-08-11.Title: Sundays in the Garden: Trey Priest // Dani Darling
2019-08-11.Desc: Join Cultivate for their Sundays in the Garden with live music in their beer garden! 12 weeks of bands, breweries, and non-profits. This week features Drafting Table Brewing Company, and this event will help raise money for Dawn Farm.

2019-08-12.Title: Paint Dexter Plein Air Festival
2019-08-12.Desc: Every summer since 2013, under the curious and watchful eye of the public, local and visiting artists in a wide-variety of mediums work outdoors for four days in and around Dexter.

2019-08-15.Title: “Welcome to Paradise,” World Premiere by Julie Marino
2019-08-15.Desc: At one age can one find a soulmate? Are there boundaries to true friendship and affection? Two people find each other in the Caribbean and find love and acceptance with each other, despite their differences in age.

2019-08-16.Title: Ann Arbor Blues Festival 2019
2019-08-16.Desc: It's 1969, the Blues threw a party and everybody came. This summer, they're doing it again and you're invited. Join in for a weekend of music surrounded by good company!

2019-08-17.Title: 2019 Fire Muster
2019-08-17.Desc: Join the Michigan Firehouse Museum for their annual Fire Muster in Riverside Park! See Fire Trucks of all types, a bucket brigade demonstration, hand pumper demonstrations, events for the kids, fire safety information and much more! This event is free to the public so bring the whole family!

2019-08-18.Title: Sundays in the Garden: Rachel Mazer
2019-08-18.Desc: Join Cultivate for their Sundays in the Garden with live music in their beer garden! 12 weeks of bands, breweries, and non-profits. This week features Bell's Brewery, and this event will help raise money for Ypsilanti Meals on Wheels.

2019-08-20.Title: Chelsea Community Fair 2019
2019-08-20.Desc: Welcome to the 2019 Chelsea Community Fair! Bring your family out to the fair to enjoy rides, animal shows, demolition derby, and various other events. Please visit the website for the ever-expanding schedule of events for this year's fair.

2019-08-21.Title: Gratzi's Farm to Table Free Cooking Demo
2019-08-21.Desc: Gratzi's seasonal Farm to Table series is back! Meet Chef John Somerville at 11:00 a.m. at the Kerrytown Farmer's Market as he procures locally sourced ingredients. Then join him that night at Gratzi Ann Arbor for a free cooking demo with a complimentary micro-antipasti.

2019-08-22.Title: “Welcome to Paradise,” World Premiere by Julie Marino
2019-08-22.Desc: At one age can one find a soulmate? Are there boundaries to true friendship and affection? Two people find each other in the Caribbean and find love and acceptance with each other, despite their differences in age.

2019-08-23.Title: Movie in the Park - Night Under the Stars
2019-08-23.Desc: Enjoy a movie in the park with the whole family on August 23rd from 8:00 to 11:00 PM at Lillie Park South! Before the movie, there will be craft and game stations set up for the kids. Food trucks will be on site for snacks and dinner. Pre-registration is required by August 19.

2019-08-23.Title: YpsiFest 2019
2019-08-23.Desc: Spanning over three days, Ypsilanti Heritage Festival is a community festival featuring arts & crafts, live music, family activities and entertainment, historical presentations and demonstrations, and so much more. Come on down to Riverside Park to enjoy the Ypsilanti Heritage Festival!

2019-08-25.Title: Sundays in the Garden: Abigail Stauffer // Kate Peterson
2019-08-25.Desc: Join Cultivate for their Sundays in the Garden with live music in their beer garden! 12 weeks of bands, breweries, and non-profits. This week features City Built Brewing Company, and this event will help raise money for Food Gatherers.

2019-08-27.Title: Jazz - Depot Town Big Band
2019-08-27.Desc: A relaxing, family friendly night of big band music and food. Go to Haab's and listen to the Depot Town Big Band play the swingin' tunes of the '30s to today on the 4th Tuesday of each month (minus December).

2019-08-29.Title: “Welcome to Paradise,” World Premiere by Julie Marino
2019-08-29.Desc: At one age can one find a soulmate? Are there boundaries to true friendship and affection? Two people find each other in the Caribbean and find love and acceptance with each other, despite their differences in age.

2019-08-31.Title: Ypsilanti Community Schools: Back to School Bash
2019-08-31.Desc: Join Ypsilanti Community Schools (YCS) for this Back to School Bash! This Free event will feature a Backpack giveaway (while supplies last)!!! This will also be an opportunity to learn about YCS enrollment information while enjoying free food, music, face painting and fun!

2019-08-31.Title: German Park Biergarten Picnic
2019-08-31.Desc: Held three times a year, German Park picnics attract thousands of visitors every year after 75 years of serving traditional German-American hospitality to the public. Please visit the website for more information.

2019-09-01.Title: Sundays in the Garden: Seth Bernard & Jordan Hamilton
2019-09-01.Desc: Join Cultivate for their Sundays in the Garden with live music in their beer garden! 12 weeks of bands, breweries, and non-profits. This week features Creston Brewery, and this event will help raise money for Educate Youth 501c3.

2019-09-03.Title: A Cappella Around Main
2019-09-03.Desc: 'A Cappella' Around Main is an 'a cappella' celebration every first Tuesday of the summer in downtown Ann Arbor! Enjoy shopping, eating, and being serenaded all at the same time! Singing groups will be strolling the sidewalks and businesses with song.  This month features the Huron Valley Harmonizers, Voices in Harmony, and the Arbor Consort, and the Women's Chamber Chorus.

2019-09-06.Title: First Fridays Ypsilanti - September 2019
2019-09-06.Desc: First Fridays Ypsilanti is a self-guided monthly art walk hosted throughout downtown Ypsilanti at multiple venues! Each month, the participating venues offer free art activities involving local artists, musicians, and/or tastings.

2019-09-08.Title: Snarky Puppy
2019-09-08.Desc: After a decade of touring and recording, Snarky Puppy suddenly found itself held up by the press and public as one of the major forces in the jazz world. A Brooklyn-based collective that grew out of the celebrated jazz program at the University of North Texas.

2019-09-13.Title: Ax Plays Brahms
2019-09-13.Desc: Serene, pastoral, and deceptively simple–no piece has come to define Aaron Copland’s reputation as the “American voice” of classical music more than the great American ballet, Appalachian Spring. We travel to the fields of Galánta with the composer, Zoltán Koldáy to continue our dance-inspired evening in Hill Auditorium. His Dances of Galánta holds a deeply personal meaning discovered by weaving through the Hungarian folk melodies from his childhood spent in Galánta surrounded by stunning orchestral colors. The distinct and fiery rhythms of Hungarian dances return and close the program with a performance of Brahms’ Piano Concerto No. 2, op. 83 in B-flat majorfeaturing celebrate pianist, Emanuel Ax.

2019-09-15.Title: Harvest Festival
2019-09-15.Desc: Join in for the annual Pittsfield Township Harvest Festival on Sunday, September 15 from 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM at the Historic Sutherland-Wilson Farm. At the Harvest Festival, learn more about the historical significance of this farmstead and the Sutherland-Wilson Family. Activities include face painting, historical house and building tours, a petting farm, hay rides, historical carriage photos, lawn games, refreshments, and more!

2019-09-15.Title: Amadeus Live: Film with Live Orchestra
2019-09-15.Desc: Winner of eight Academy Awards including Best Picture and Best Actor, the 1984 motion picture Amadeus makes its UMS debut projected on a large screen, with Mozart's celebrated works performed live by the Detroit Symphony Orchestra and the UMS Choral Union.

2019-09-15.Title: Orphan Car Show 2019
2019-09-15.Desc: Vintage cars at their best! 2019 celebrates 23 years of this one of a kind car show. Orphan vehicles are ones that no longer have a manufacturer and are at least 25 years old. Hudson, Corvair, Packard, Studebaker are just a few that will be displayed at Riverside Park in Ypsilanti.

2019-09-18.Title: Jenny Lewis: On The Line Tour 2019
2019-09-18.Desc: The Ark presents Jenny Lewis: On the Line Tour 2019 at The Michigan Theater!

2019-09-20.Title: Saline Oktoberfest 2019
2019-09-20.Desc: Join Saline for their 15th annual Oktoberfest in the heart of Downtown Saline! Saline's Oktoberfest celebrates their relationship with sister city Lindenberg in Germany. There is plenty to drink and eat, music, dancing, and all types of entertainment.

2019-09-21.Title: Free Shredding Event
2019-09-21.Desc: Stop by the Pittsfield Township Administration Building parking lot to shred up to 5 banker boxes full of paper! No hanging folders or 3-ring binders, please. This event is free for residents only, and proof of residency (drivers license, utility bill, etc.) is required.

2019-09-21.Title: West Cross Cider Festival 2019
2019-09-21.Desc: Michigan's premier hard cider festival is celebrating its second year! This event will take place on College Place, near Tower Inn and Cross St.

2019-09-24.Title: Jazz - Depot Town Big Band
2019-09-24.Desc: A relaxing, family-friendly night of big band music and food. Go to Haab's and listen to the Depot Town Big Band play the swingin' tunes of the '30s to today on the 4th Tuesday of each month (minus December).

2019-10-04.Title: First Fridays Ypsilanti - October 2019
2019-10-04.Desc: First Fridays Ypsilanti is a self-guided monthly art walk hosted throughout downtown Ypsilanti at multiple venues! Each month, the participating venues offer free art activities involving local artists, musicians, and/or tastings.

2019-10-05.Title: Grupo Corpo
2019-10-05.Desc: The phenomenal Brazilian dance company Grupo Corpo makes its third UMS appearance with a double bill of Bach and Gira, two wildly different works that showcase the 21-member group's extraordinary range.

2019-10-11.Title: Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center
2019-10-11.Desc: This concert celebrates the intrepid American spirit by featuring two pairs of composers that shaped the course of American music. This concert is performed by 13 members of the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center.

2019-10-12.Title: Fall Fiber Expo
2019-10-12.Desc: Join us for a fiber fantasy - wool, alpaca, linen, cotton and more - from the plant or animal to the finished product.  Click "Visit the Site" for a list of vendors!

2019-10-12.Title: Made in America
2019-10-12.Desc: An orchestra reacts to and serves the cultural needs of its community. Through this process, the sound and identity of an orchestra are molded. For Joan Tower, the individuality formed through this process became the colors to fill the canvas of Made In America. Premiered in 2005, the piece toured through orchestras in all 50 states filling halls of all shapes and sizes. The piece inherently celebrates and embraces differences as it is given a new identity with every stop it makes from California to New York. This evening of music penned in America continues with Stravinsky’s revised 1950 version of The Fairy’s Kiss, originally written for the New York City Ballet. It was also in New York where Dvořák wrote two of his most memorable themes in the opening movement of his Concerto in B minor for Cello and Orchestra. The final moments of this noteworthy evening of music feature the heartfelt coda written by Dvořák in memory of his sister-in-law, Josefina Kaunitzová.

2019-10-13.Title: Fire Open House
2019-10-13.Desc: Learn about fire prevention and safety at the annual Fire Open House event!  Check out the trucks, watch demonstrations, spray the fire hose, meet the firefighters, learn about fire safety, and more!

2019-10-14.Title: HAAB'S 85th ANNIVERSARY
2019-10-14.Desc: Haab's was a bit overwhelmed last year by the amazingly positive response they received when celebrating their anniversary! So many people immediately made reservations for this year while attending last year that Haab's has decided to continue the tradition.

2019-10-16.Title: Edgefest 2019: OUT West
2019-10-16.Desc: Kerrytown Concert House presents Edgefest, it's annual 4-day experimental "out" jazz and creative new music festival. Edgefest 2019: OUT West - explores the rich historical contributions of West Coast artists in the development of avant jazz improvisation and new music. Both free and ticketed performances will be happening around the Ann Arbor area for this event.

2019-10-16.Title: Isango Ensemble: The Magic Flute and A Man of Good Hope
2019-10-16.Desc: Isango Ensemble is a South African theater company that draws its artists from the townships surrounding Cape Town. The company reimagines classics from the Western theater canon while finding new context for the stories within a South African township setting, thereby creating inventive work relevant to the heritage of the nation and a "joyful fusion of two cultures."

2019-10-18.Title: Denis Matsuev, piano
2019-10-18.Desc: After his triumph at the 11th International Tchaikovsky Competition in 1998, Denis Matsuev has become a virtuoso in the grandest of Russian pianistic traditions and has established himself as one of the most prominent pianists of his generation. His third recital and sixth performance since his 2010 UMS debut features a program of virtuosic works by Liszt and Scriabin.

2019-10-19.Title: Chick Corea Trilogy w/ Christian McBride and Brian Blad
2019-10-19.Desc: Their first outing as a trio in 2014 resulted in a three-CD set, Trilogy, which earned two Grammy Awards. Corea, who began playing with the genre-shattering bands of Miles Davis in the late 1960s and early '70s has moved from straight-ahead to avant-garde, bebop to jazz-rock fusion, and children's songs to symphonic works, all while racking up 63 Grammy nominations and 22 wins.

2019-10-22.Title: Jazz - Depot Town Big Band
2019-10-22.Desc: A relaxing, family-friendly night of big band music and food. Go to Haab's and listen to the Depot Town Big Band play the swingin' tunes of the '30s to today on the 4th Tuesday of each month (minus December).

2019-10-24.Title: Zauberland (Magic Land): An Encounter w/ Schumann's Dichterliebe
2019-10-24.Desc: A quintessential work of European Romanticism, Schumann's Dichterliebe is infused with yearning for love and landscapes that no longer exist. Composer Bernard Foccroulle and writer Martin Crimp created 16 new songs to be performed seamlessly alongside Schumann's original work, opening up a new dramatic dialogue between past and present.

2019-10-25.Title: ypsiGLOW
2019-10-25.Desc: YpsiGLOW returns for its fourth year! At sunset, downtown Ypsilanti will glow brightly with hundreds of community and artist creations for a night of dancing, DJs, interactive art activities, black-lit stations, street performances, glowing window displays, and more!

2019-10-25.Title: Sankai Juku - Meguri: Teeming Sea, Tranquil Land
2019-10-25.Desc: Over the course of the past 40 years, the work of Ushio Amagatsu and Sankai Juku has become known worldwide for its elegance, refinement, technical precision, and emotional depth. His contemporary Butoh creations are sublime visual spectacles and deeply moving theatrical experiences. His 2015 work, Meguri: Teeming Sea, Tranquil Land, is an exquisite poetic meditation on the passage of time as symbolized by the circulation of water and the seasonal transformation of the earth, set against an upstage of relief of sea lily fossil images.

2019-10-27.Title: An Evening with Pokey LaFarge: The Ark's 23rd Annual Fundraiser
2019-10-27.Desc: Over the last decade, Pokey LaFarge has won the hearts of music lovers across the globe with his creative mix of early jazz, string ragtime, country blues, and western swing, all while writing songs that ring true n both spirit and sound. His music transcends the confines of genre, continually challenging the notion that tradition-bearers fail to push musical boundaries.

2019-10-31.Title: 19th Annual Halloween Treat Parade
2019-10-31.Desc: Its the 19th annual Treat Parade in downtown Ann Arbor! Area merchants welcome your little costumed characters to the neighborhood with greets and treats. Black and orange balloons will fly from participating businesses. Stop by the Ann Arbor District Library (343 S. Fifth Ave.) between 10:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. for a Halloween Party that includes stories, puppets, and trick-or-treats.

2019-11-01.Title: First Fridays Ypsilanti - November 2019
2019-11-01.Desc: First Fridays Ypsilanti is a self-guided monthly art walk hosted throughout downtown Ypsilanti at multiple venues! Each month, the participating venues offer free art activities involving local artists, musicians, and/or tastings.

2019-11-01.Title: yMusic
2019-11-01.Desc: Founded in New York City in 2008, yMusic uses its unique configuration (string trio, flute, clarinet, and trumpet) to "playfully overstep the boundaries of musical genres" (New Yorker). This concert is a celebration of young composers, featuring works by luminaries such as Caroline Shaw, Michigan natives Andrew Norman and Shara Nova (aka My Brightest Diamond), Missy Mazzoli, and Gabriella Smith.

2019-11-02.Title: John Cameron Mitchell - The Origin of Love Tour
2019-11-02.Desc: Mitchell, the double Tony Award-winning co-creator of the long-running off-Broadway musical Hedwig & the Angry Inch, makes his UMS debut performing songs and stories from the groundbreaking work. Hedwig, whom Mitchell played in drag, evolved over time in club and cabaret settings into a transgender rocker who had a bad operation and whose love life and career were on the skids.

2019-11-02.Title: Liszt & Tchaikovky
2019-11-02.Desc: We soar through the Rocky Mountains to the Garden of Gods and atop Pikes Peak in Wang Jie’s Symphonic Overture on “America the Beautiful.” From the orchestra comes a majestic fugue which traces the silhouette of this prominent peak with faint echos of the familiar patriotic song written atop the same mountain. Cascading crowns of notes continue through Liszt’s Piano Concerto No. 1 in E-flat major. Your A2SO is joined by pianist, Anton Nel displaying the pinnacle of pianistic achievement. This evening of new heights concludes with the emotional summit of Tchaikovsky’s Symphony No. 5, Op. 64. The vivid colors of his penultimate symphony present “fate” as the central character while casting a mysterious veil over the secrets of his personal life.

2019-11-15.Title: Teac Damsa - Loch na hEala (Swan Lake)
2019-11-15.Desc: Dance is interwoven with storytelling, song, and live music, all performed by a company of 13 world-class performers. The Dublin-based band Slow Moving Clouds has created a score that combines Nordic and Irish traditional music with minimalist and experimental influences. Premiering in 2016, Loch na hEala (Swan Lake) has toured the world and has won awards for best production and best modern choreography.

2019-11-16.Title: Vivaldi's Four Seasons / Max Richter's Vivaldi Recomposed
2019-11-16.Desc: Winner of the 2015 European Cultural Prize for Music, whose previous recipients include Daniel Barenboim, Plácido Domingo, and the Berlin Philharmonic Orchestra, Hope now serves as the ensemble’s music director and performs Vivaldi’s Four Seasons alongside a new take on the work by British composer Max Richter.

2019-11-20.Title: Orchestre Métropolitain de Montréal w/ Yannick-Nézet-Séguin and Joyce DiDonato
2019-11-20.Desc: In addition to his artistic leadership roles with the Philadelphia Orchestra and the Metropolitan Opera, Nézet-Séguin has served as artistic director and principal conductor of the Orchestre Métropolitain de Montréal since 2000. Together, DiDonato and Nézet-Séguin perform Mozart arias, and the orchestra returns for Bruckner's Symphony No. 4, demonstrating the ensemble's boldness and excellence.

2019-11-22.Title: Stew & The Negro Problem - Notes of a Native Song
2019-11-22.Desc: Tony Award-winning playwright and singer Stew, alongside his longtime collaborator Heidi Rodewald, pays homage to the art and activism of James Baldwin in this new music and theater experience. A contemporary commentary on Baldwin's 1955 collection of essays on being Black in America, Notes of a Native Song is an irreverent and spirited rock 'n' roll song cycle. Stew and his band, The Negro Problem, use Baldwin's work to examine our lingering civil rights woes through a rapturous mix of rock, jazz, and soul. His uniquely incisive lyrics pay homage to the writer, who spoke uncomfortable truths about race, love, class division, and politics.

2019-11-26.Title: Jazz - Depot Town Big Band
2019-11-26.Desc: A relaxing, family-friendly night of big band music and food. Go to Haab's and listen to the Depot Town Big Band play the swingin' tunes of the '30s to today on the 4th Tuesday of each month (minus December).

2019-12-01.Title: Big Band Holidays - Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra w/ Wynton Marsalis
2019-12-01.Desc: They celebrate the most wonderful time of the year with seasonal confections that put the heart and soul into the holidays. With fresh arrangements, playful improvisation, and abundant good cheer, their big band arrangements of songs both sacred and secular feature the core group of grooving instrumentalists along with two charismatic vocalists: smooth-as-silk baritone Denzil Sinclaire and teenage phenomenon Alexis Morrast, a recent first-place winner of the nationally broadcast "Showtime at the Apollo."

2019-12-06.Title: Midnight Madness
2019-12-06.Desc: It's party time in the Main Street area! Stores stay open late with lots of holiday specials. While you shop, enjoy the sidewalk entertainment, and say hello to Santa Claus and Miss Washtenaw County, who will be roaming the sidewalks! Join local businesses as they welcome guests with prizes, refreshments and extra special savings. Please visit the website for more information.

2019-12-07.Title: Handel's Messiah
2019-12-07.Desc: Handel's Messiah was composed over the course of a month in 1741, six months before its premiere in Dublin at a new concert hall. Nearly 300 years later, Handel's Messiah still evokes joy, and UMS's presentation of the oratorio fills audiences with emotion for both the beauty of the piece and the pride of hearing friends and colleagues from the community bring this glorious work to life.

2019-12-10.Title: Sheku Kanneh-Mason, cello
2019-12-10.Desc: His performance was greeted with universal excitement after being watched by nearly two billion people globally. The winner of the 2016 BBC Young Musician competition, Sheku comes to Ann Arbor twice this season: once in this solo recital with his older sister, Isata, the night before his Carnegie Hall debut.

2019-12-13.Title: Holiday Pops
2019-12-13.Desc: Join your Ann Arbor Symphony Orchestra in welcoming the holidays with some of the most beloved music of the season. Hill Auditorium will glow with the magical spirt of this cherished A2SO tradition. This year, they present Duke Ellington’s Nutcracker Suite. Enjoy this unique and imaginative jazz interpretation of Tchaikovsky’s timeless ballet. Hill Auditorium will ring with the vibrant colors of Ellington’s arrangement as the A2SO celebrates the holiday season.

2020-01-18.Title: Mozart Birthday Bash
2020-01-18.Desc: The imaginative energy that fills Mozart’s “Turkish” Violin Concerto is that of youth and idealism. While it does not contain a cadenza, his Fifth Violin Concerto features writing that exudes the freedom and lyricism that would suggest otherwise. The A2SO proudly welcomes Itamar Zorman as the featured soloist on this captivating work. The theme of youth continues with Mozart’s Symphony No. 29 in A major. Written at the age of 18-years-old, it is overflowing with a sense of self-confidence that confirms the composer’s creative genius. From pastoral scenes to the mystery of nocturnal landscapes, Symphony No. 29 paints a sophisticated symphonic drama. Our celebration of Mozart is rounded out with a selection of some the most famous choruses ever penned in the operatic cannon.

2020-03-21.Title: West Side Story
2020-03-21.Desc: Don’t let the mysterious shimmer that opens this concert and Diana Syrse’sColección de Readlidades deceive you–this program packs a remarkably vivacious punch. As the texture broadens the rhythms of Mexico are revealed as the backbone to this gripping piece. To Puerto Rico, we go next with Roberto Sierra’s Concerto for Saxophones and Orchestra as the A2SO is joined by saxophonist and Detroit native, James Carter. A virtuosic blend of jazz, classical, and Latin styles come together alive with the spirt of improvisation for this furiously colorful concerto. The energy continues with Arturo MárquezDanzón No. 2. Growing from the foundational rhythm of the clave, Márquez pays his respects to the Cuban danzón tradition. Our evening celebrating the impact of Latin American culture on classical music comes to a dramatic close with the timeless story of love and loss and Leonard Bernstein’s Symphonic Dances from West Side Story.

2020-04-25.Title: Measha & Mahler
2020-04-25.Desc: Your A2SO’s historic 2019/2020 season comes to a commanding conclusion with a glowing performance from Soprano Measha Brueggergosman. Feelings of love, longing, and loss from three compositional generations will be sung in Brueggergosman’s debut with the A2SO. Hector Berlioz’s Les Nuits D’été (Summer Nights) sets the text of Théophile Gautierand in an unusually passionate and personal manner. While it is a mystery who Berlioz wrote the songs for, a powerful feeling of desire is undeniable. The sway of a waltz in Erik Satie’s Je Te Veux is mesmerizing and you will lose yourself in the story of passion told by Henry Pacory’s text. Selections from William Bolcom’s Cabaret Songs are a “highbrow” nod to the composer’s “lowbrow” days growing up in Seattle playing in vaudeville shows. The ambitious program for the season finale is rounded out with Verdi’s exploration of fate in La Forza del Destinoand Mahler’s sprawling and tempestuous First Symphony.
